name: impor
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2
body: |- wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2))

stmt.origin: bitr4i(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2))
-| wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))
-| wb(wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2))
-| wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))
-| wb(wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2))
-| wb(wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2), wo(wn(w0), wo(w1, w2)))

cumulated.origin: |- wb(wi(w0, wo(w1, w2)), wo(wo(wn(w0), w1), w2))

comment: An equivalent formula for implying a disjunction. (Contributed by Giovanni Mascellani, 15-Sep-2017.)
